newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on liquidity crunch.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on liquidity crunch.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Tuesday as major investors kept to the sidelines amid a shortage of funds, dealers said.
They said most major institutions and foreign funds were quiet ahead of the December 31 financial close, while individuals were short of cash to finance fresh investments.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 23.30 points, or 1.62 percent, to close at 1,417.82. Losers led gainers 192 to 63.
PTCL fell 1.10 rupees to 27 and Hub Power Co 0.60 to 33.
